DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the relationship between plasma drug levels and receptor binding in brain using PET; and to evaluate safety and tolerability after a single administration of PF-05212365 in healthy volunteers
DOC.brief_title: To Evaluate The Relationship Between Plasma Drug Levels And Receptor Binding In Brain Using PET (Positron Emission Tomography) In Healthy Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Healthy male and/or female subjects of nonchildbearing potential between the ages of 18 and 55 years, inclusive Evidence or history of clinically significant hematological, renal, endocrine, pulmonary, gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, hepatic, psychiatric, neurologic, or allergic disease. History of regular alcohol consumption exceeding 7 drinks/week for females or 14 drinks/week for males (1 drink = 5 ounces (150 mL) of wine or 12 ounces (360 mL) of beer or 1.5 ounces (45 mL) of hard liquor) within 6 months of screening Fulfillment of any of the MRI contraindications on the standard radiography screening questionnaire
